Audio and video synchronization sucks bad. Other than that, very nice. First few episodes are almost unwatchable because of lack of synchronization though.

For the first 3 episodes, the audio came in a bit late,, try adjusting the audio to come in at -4700ms. You can do this with the Windows Media Player Classic by going to the menubar and click Play-->Audio-->Options. In the Audio Switcher tab, check the Audio Time Shift checkbox and adjust the value to -4700ms. Click 'Apply' and restart the video. Just remember to uncheck the time shift on the next video you play :)

i don't know why people keep complaining about audio being out of sync.  it's not out of sync here using WMP11.

perhaps people with sync issues have slower computers, full hdds or are just using crappy players because it's only 2.43 mbit video.  i see no latency in the audio whatsoever and that's even with seeking back and forth manually to different points of the video.  it's syncs perfectly and immediately.

Kudos to the ripper.  I have had this series in widescreen 4:3 DVD for a long time but pales in comparison to this full BDHD.

Major Richard "Dick" D. Winters (January 21, 1918 â€“ January 2, 2011)[1] was a United States Army officer and decorated war veteran. He commanded Company "E", 2nd Battalion, 506th Parachute Infantry Regiment, 101st Airborne Division, during World War II.

Gen. David Petraeus, who has commanded the 101st Airborne Division during his career, said in a statement on Monday that "Major Winters embodied the very best of what a leader and soldier should be. He and the men of Easy Company lived the "brotherhood of the close fight."

"The deeds of Dick Winters and his men from Easy Company will always live on," Petraeus said

"Dick Winters volunteered to go to war, leading paratroopers into unknown, yet certain, dangers. He led by both command and example; his wartime philosophy was simple -- 'Follow me.'"
